Ranked-Choice Voting has no partisan or ideological bias. In fact, both Democrats and Republicans use it to select candidates. So do other parties.

What's different about #RankedChoiceVoting is that it does a better job ensuring election outcomes reflect the will of the voters.

Some benefits of #RankedChoiceVoting:
✅Every vote counts
✅Voters feel free to vote *for* what they want, instead of against what they fear
✅Candidates need majority support to win
✅No "spoilers", "wasted votes" or "split votes"
✅Incentivizes positive, issue-based campaigns

Ranked-Choice Voting removes the pressure to vote "lesser evil" to stop the candidate you fear most.
With #RankedChoiceVoting you can vote for your favorite candidate, and if they don't win, your vote can still count.
No more fear of "spoilers", "wasted votes", or "split votes".

People rank their choices all the time.
At a restaurant, if they're out of your 1st choice, you order your 2nd choice.
When you're getting food with your friends, if your 1st choice isn't what most want, you can still get your 2nd choice.
That's how #RankedChoiceVoting works.
